subject: Display stored properties in list_stack_resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-09 02:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/5bae9e071d0fc7fb3835f928462639192e4ad577', 'message': "Display stored properties in list_stack_resources

When the user shows a resource with detail on, they generally want to see
the properties that the resource was created or last updated with. Instead
we re-resolve intrinsic functions, thus doing live lookups of e.g. get_attr
functions that may return different data. It's also very slow.

Since we already store the actual properties of the resource for use during
updates, display these instead as the user would expect.

Change-Id: I71cdd90be992859d9d8427f6ffb4ca495d6febd4
"}]
commit_message:
Display stored properties in list_stack_resources

When the user shows a resource with detail on, they generally want to see
the properties that the resource was created or last updated with. Instead
we re-resolve intrinsic functions, thus doing live lookups of e.g. get_attr
functions that may return different data. It's also very slow.

Since we already store the actual properties of the resource for use during
updates, display these instead as the user would expect.

Change-Id: I71cdd90be992859d9d8427f6ffb4ca495d6febd4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/02/472502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: schema = resource.properties_schema props = resource.frozen_definition().properties(schema, resource.context) def get_property(prop_name): try: return props[prop_name] return {k: get_property(k) for k in schema}
deleted_lines: def get_property(prop): try: return resource.properties[prop] return dict((prop, get_property(prop)) for prop in resource.properties_schema.keys())

commit_message:
Update Cinder API endpoints to v3

Remove the deprecated cinder (v1) endpoint, and add v3.
Also update %(tenant_id) to $(project_id).

Change-Id: Ica8e5acea517d766419faaa16f31de6d78c58feb
Closes-Bug: #1676875

commit_message:
Add support to configure Num of Storage sacks

Gnocchi 4 supports storage sacks during upgrade. lets make this
configurable if we want to use more metricd workers.

Change-Id: I27390b8babf8c4ef35f4c9b8a2e5be69fb9a54ee

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-24 10:36:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/968edefb1c767b0a323008cb5ed548807f58d607', 'message': 'Write md5sum for service config directories

The configuration generated by docker-puppet may change on update,

Change-Id: I40d9080cf3ad708ef4ed91e46d2b2ae1138bb9c3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-24 14:55:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/69f8939643270107c9c663ec2987b9732c482f7f', 'message': 'Write md5sum for service config directories

The configuration generated by docker-puppet may change on update,
so checksum the combined files from the config-data directories,

Change-Id: I40d9080cf3ad708ef4ed91e46d2b2ae1138bb9c3
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-27 07:38:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1f74c1c2436cad2464bb1b0ec26d23cd73f17ba4', 'message': 'Write md5sum for service config directories

The configuration generated by docker-puppet may change on update,
so checksum the combined files from the config-data directories,
to enable detecting those that have changed and restarting the
appropriate containers - we need to merge this checksum into
the environment passed to the containters, as this will cause
paunch to correctly restart containers when the configuration
generated changes, even if the rest of the json definition
provided by heat does not.

Change-Id: I40d9080cf3ad708ef4ed91e46d2b2ae1138bb9c3
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-30 16:44:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/69c5e0afabe570bc14a9b2fb9fd9b486c7464731', 'message': 'Write md5sum for service config directories

The configuration generated by docker-puppet may change on update,
so checksum the combined files from the config-data directories,
to enable detecting those that have changed and restarting the
appropriate containers - we need to merge this checksum into
the environment passed to the containters, as this will cause
paunch to correctly restart containers when the configuration
generated changes, even if the rest of the json definition

commit_message:
Write md5sum for service config directories

The configuration generated by docker-puppet may change on update,
so checksum the combined files from the config-data directories,
to enable detecting those that have changed and restarting the
appropriate containers - we need to merge this checksum into
the environment passed to the containters, as this will cause
paunch to correctly restart containers when the configuration
generated changes, even if the rest of the json definition
provided by heat does not.

Change-Id: I40d9080cf3ad708ef4ed91e46d2b2ae1138bb9c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/81/467581/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Write a checksum of the config-data dir, this is used as a # salt to trigger container restart when the config changes find /var/lib/config-data/${NAME} -type f -print0 | xargs -0 md5sum | md5sum | awk '{print $1}' > /var/lib/config-data/${NAME}.md5sum

subject: Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 13:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rebalance-exit-codes-ee79621190315a5a.yaml', 'manifests/ringbuilder/rebalance.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/9ffca830e59966f5bfafcd4abf74f710eb9e1d16', 'message': "Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings

If the ring has been rebalanced recently, the next call to rebalance
will not rebalance again if the time passed is shorter than
min_part_time. swift-ring-builder returns an exit code of 1 in this
case, which is a warning, but not a hard error (errors will use an exit
code of 2).

It makes sense therefore to expect an exit code of 0 or 1 and only fail
if it's different.

Closes-Bug: 1677588
Change-Id: I03dd075c590344a920099c57b6a7530f103e0ede
(cherry picked from commit c64538ef8387128226dedbb51cac6548570d84e3)

commit_message:
Fix raising an error on rebalance warnings

If the ring has been rebalanced recently, the next call to rebalance
will not rebalance again if the time passed is shorter than
min_part_time. swift-ring-builder returns an exit code of 1 in this
case, which is a warning, but not a hard error (errors will use an exit
code of 2).

It makes sense therefore to expect an exit code of 0 or 1 and only fail
if it's different.

Closes-Bug: 1677588
Change-Id: I03dd075c590344a920099c57b6a7530f103e0ede
(cherry picked from commit c64538ef8387128226dedbb51cac6548570d84e3)

commit_message:
Correct validation of wait conditon

This changes:
1. if the referenced wait condition is invalid,
   return '' when resolve attribute.
2. if the referenced wait condition is invalid,
   raise error with correct message.

Closes-Bug: #1666747

Change-Id: I69248c2bd80246ea6d08c1f140885e4b461353a0

commit_message:
Add 'DELETED', 'NO_ZONE' and 'SUCCESS' status for objects.

- Fix missing DELETED status in code-base
 which existed in database [1]
- Solve invalid objects when objects need to validate
 with Schema validator [2] [3]
- Fix missing NO_ZONE and SUCCESS status in code-base
 which fixed in pool_manager[4] and used in worker[5]
- Add UTs (phase 1)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/070_liberty.py#L29

[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2396

[3] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/tests/unit/test_pool_manager/test_service.py#L247

[4] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/pool_manager/service.py#L45-L48

[5] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/worker/tasks/zone.py#L380-L399

Change-Id: Ic359498e991ec00aedbd2dda48c1d49536c4ec20
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Fix remaining API tests under python3

This fixes the address_name method to return text, as the to_text
method from dnspython returns bytes, and make 3 new test modules pass.

Change-Id: I5d0e75bd9acdd517ed4a94b1959783a2437cf5a5

commit_message:
Using wrong connector parameter in V3 attach

The V3 attach implementation is pulling a `hostname` parameter from
the connector.  The problem is that the connector doesn't have a
`hostname` member, it does however have a `host` member which is what
we should be using here.

Co-Authored-By: j-griffith <john.griffith8@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1c74b5df9478c0dbd26d7fbd7c0ecc3f2aa0a6ef
Closes-Bug: #1693333

commit_message:
Add libssl packages to bindep

The pep8 images in infra no longer have ssl installed by
default so we have to specify them in bindep.

Change-Id: Icbdb5d442935438f01031f745157a8b39cd672a4

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting,
which is replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx
releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I4b08daf51278cbd985092c9acd58a628f5f71d1c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/64/472564/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The details related to how a package should be installed may depend on your environment. If possible, you should rely on packages provided by your Linux and/or Openstack distribution. If you use ``pip``, follow these steps to install networking-bagpipe: * identify the version of the networking-bagpipe package that matches your Openstack version: * Liberty: most recent of 3.0.x * Mitaka: most recent of 4.0.x * Newton: most recent of 5.0.x * Ocata: most recent of 6.0.x * Pike: most recent of 7.0.x * (see `<https://releases.openstack.org/index.html>`_) * indicate pip to (a) install precisely this version and (b) take into account Openstack upper constraints on package versions for dependencies (example for ocata):: $ pip install -c https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/ocata networking-bagpipe=6.0.0
deleted_lines: The networking-bagpipe package (including the :ref:`bagpipe-bgp` component) can be installed with:: pip install -c http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/<release> networking-bagpipe

commit_message:
Policy in code for deployments

This commit implements policy in code for deployments
API. The default rules for the deployments API were
removed from the policy.json and moved into code under
murano.common.policies.deployment.

This commit specifically:
  - Moves policy actions related to the deployments
    API from the policy.json into code.
  - Documents the API information and paths associated with
    each deployment-related policy.

Partially Implements: blueprint policy-in-code
Change-Id: I246261b6df4b5225b67499c89281b942013007ed

added_lines: --- deprecations: - The blocking executor has been deprecated for removal in Rocky. Its usage was never recommended for applications, and it has no test coverage. Applications should choose the appropriate threading model that maps their usage instead.

commit_message:
Support subnet DHCP enabling and disabling

This patch supports subnet DHCP enabling and disabling and gracefully
subnet updating by comparing new DHCP options with old lsp DHCP options.

Change-Id: I947c20c93ac134f3a78289211e1ad6510ab5d4c6
Closes-Bug: #1682355
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Ia8274b7db7ff0f4e45acc778f7061c2add93c65f
Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
Fix issues with value pool-manger and bind9 tests

- PoolNameserver's port must is integer to get successful validation[1].
- PoolNsRecord's value must is string format [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/objects/pool_nameserver.py#L37

[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/objects/pool_target_option.py#L37

Change-Id: I5ff240606dd564a1318c92ec2dad9bc88a217b31

commit_message:
Fix issue with value in nsd4 and powerdns test-case

- Whole values in 'options' must string format [1] which have
field relation from PoolTarget object into PoolTargetOptionList object.

- Currently, the values will not match schema if perform a validation.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/objects/pool_target_option.py#L37

Change-Id: Ib356ae6a52f72170b6267a0c2532f2bc97c7d843

Add neutron periodic job with ryu master

commit_message:
Add seperate pep8 job for Browbeat

https://github.com/openstack/browbeat/blob/master/tox.ini

For some time the 'linters' job was running both the Ansible linting
script in the Browbeat tox.ini and the pep8 tests. Looking back I'm not
entierly sure how that ever worked. Anyways it was fixed recently so
I'm trying to add a new job for pep8. If this isn't the right way to
go about that please let me know.

Change-Id: I683b10beaedb49a0d8d2188817ce69f8df8ed921

commit_message:
GPFS: Changing default value of NFS server type

Spectrum Scale provide NFS service with Ganesha server
by default (protocol node). So altering the default value
of NFS server for easiness.

Implements: blueprint gpfs-nfs-server-type-default-value-change

Change-Id: I2e3adeca58505c2da4a5675f7342bb2a174078cc

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 2 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: Ie5fc71b2d9e53a0beef86d411da1d680cccf3dd2

commit_message:
Make container names consistent

This commit change the container names to consistently use the `_` char
as a word separator and make the kolla external config file match the
container name to make operators' life easier.

Change-Id: Ibac9d76dde474b94c3cb86031ead0fd0327e126f

commit_message:
Handle re-created resources in StackUpdateManager

Since Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71 got merged in Heat, we
can get into a state where a failed resource is recreated during update
after clearing a hook. That means that when we poll for events, we need
to check for that additional action and not limit to updates.

Change-Id: I2191a3f3df426eaa91fdd5b00299193a32efe366
Closes-Bug: #1677548
(cherry picked from commit ba113ca18825cf2eeafa7011b329aa96262d27e8)

commit_message:
Explain how to use firewall in tripleo

Many customers are asking to setup firewall rules to allow monitoring solution
or add restriction.

This is tested and works on newton.

Change-Id: Id7022b55be1cdcb61b3b7f018a3c240c56e8b8d5
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/52/466252/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Firewall Management ------------------- Iptables rules are automaticly deploy on overcloud nodes to open only the port who are needed to get openstack working. Rules can be added during the deployement when is needed as for a monitoring system:: parameter_defaults: controllerExtraConfig: tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules: '301 allow zabbix': port: 10050 proto: tcp source: 10.0.0.8 action: accept But also rules can be more restrictive. The number use at definition of a rule will determine where the iptables rule will be insert. As example, rabbitmq rule number is 109 by default. If I want to restrein it, I can do:: parameter_defaults: controllerExtraConfig: tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules: '098 allow rabbit from internalapi network': port: [4369,5672,25672] proto: tcp source: 10.0.0.0/24 action: accept tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules: '099 drop other rabbit acess': port: [4369,5672,25672] proto: tcp action: drop .. References .. _`Puppet-tripleo firewall rule`: https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/firewall/rule.pp

commit_message:
Remove support for py34.

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ieb56cf5facaecc9f0af2904fef99104446ca8299

commit_message:
Multiqueue support for OvsDpdkBond

This patch allows the Multiqueue setting for DPDK bonds. In case of DPDK
bonds, the Multiqueue setting needs to be done for each of the interfaces
attached to the bond.

Implements: blueprint ovs-2-6-features-dpdk
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I21b46cee902a17f13df51d456648368e468aadb7

commit_message:
Use os-net-config mapping file when interface in bond or bridge

Os-net-config was not using the user supplied mapping file to map
interface names for interfaces in bonds or bridges.  Fix is to set
the mapping file info when creating interface objects in bonds/bridges.

Closes-Bug: 1695122

Change-Id: I063256b93c44c2e7a05d9820b0c1f6bf5b73d7a0

added_lines: def _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping): """Update object's members fields and pass mapping info to members.""" members = [] members_json = json.get('members') if members_json: if isinstance(members_json, list): for member in members_json: member.update({'nic_mapping': nic_mapping}) member.update({'persist_mapping': persist_mapping}) members.append(object_from_json(member)) else: msg = 'Members must be a list.' raise InvalidConfigException(msg) return members members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) members = _update_members(json, nic_mapping, persist_mapping) (use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers, nm_controlled) = _BaseOpts.base_opts_from_json( json, include_primary=False) members_json[0].update({'nic_mapping': nic_mapping}) members_json[0].update({'persist_mapping': persist_mapping}) member.update({'nic_mapping': nic_mapping}) member.update({'persist_mapping': persist_mapping})

commit_message:
Clarify comment about swift-object-expirer for RDO

The rational for packaging swift-object-expirer in
openstack-swift-proxy is detailed in
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1382921

It is a conscious packaging choice and not a bug, and as so update the
comment in swift-object-expirer image.

Change-Id: Ibccfa1482d3aeccf86a57603d9dedecbcc7d097c

commit_message:
Replace messaging.get_transport with get_rpc_transport

The get_transport method was deprecated in the oslo.messaging
5.24.2 release in favor of get_rpc_transport and
get_notification_transport. We are already using get_notification_transport,
we just need to change to use get_rpc_transport.
Change-Id: I44a1c4fc3db1b92a9466d3fe8e1308856f8277c6

commit_message:
Fix OSProfiler issue for Swift and Redis driver

There are two changes involved in this patch:

1. Missing OSProfiler suppport for Swift driver
2. Fix RuntimeError of Redis driver because of the new decorator of
   OSProfiler.

Change-Id: Ibc888955a0945a20fe3411db9b9420a6371bbd05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/26/459926/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from osprofiler import profiler controller = controllers.MessageController(self) if (self.conf.profiler.enabled and self.conf.profiler.trace_message_store): return profiler.trace_cls("swift_message_controller")(controller) else: return controller controller = controllers.SubscriptionController(self) if (self.conf.profiler.enabled and self.conf.profiler.trace_message_store): return profiler.trace_cls("swift_subscription_" "controller")(controller) else: return controller controller = controllers.ClaimController(self) if (self.conf.profiler.enabled and self.conf.profiler.trace_message_store): return profiler.trace_cls("swift_claim_controller")(controller) else: return controller
deleted_lines: return controllers.MessageController(self) return controllers.SubscriptionController(self) return controllers.ClaimController(self)

subject: Log a warning if there is only one cell when listing instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 16:09:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fa76d1d49c7ac47a55f1653b20ba00bf584beac0', 'message': "WIP: Update CELLS cache if we only have cell0

Until we have a smarter timeout in the CELLS cache,
we can hit a case where the following happens:

1. run map_cell0 which creates the cell0 cell mapping
2. start nova-api with multiple workers
3. list instances; this caches cell0 in CELLS on a
   worker
4. run simple_cell_setup to create cell1 and map
   hosts and instances to that cell
5. create a server; this goes into cell1
6. list instances; if we hit the worker that has cell0
   cached in CELLS, we don't check cell1 and don't
   return the server created in step 5.

This patch checks the CELLS cache to see if it only
has one mapping and it's cell0, and if so, queries
for more mappings to update the cache in case we now
have cell1 mapped.

This is obviously inefficient but is a short term
workaround until we have some smarter updates of the
cache when new cells are mapped.

Change-Id: I8fcfe0554e0f263224afd0d39403463df80d4cce
Related-Bug: #1669473
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-02 20:06:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f4c7bb9323c1e49e14720083d99541f8c5bf56f4', 'message': 'Log a warning if there is only one cell when listing instances

commit_message:
Log a warning if there is only one cell when listing instances

We expect to have at least two cells when listing instances, cell0
and the main cell. If the operator deployed cell0 and started nova-api
before creating the main cell we need to log a warning informing them
that something is wrong and they will need to restart nova-api to
refresh the cache once the main cell is created.

Change-Id: I8fcfe0554e0f263224afd0d39403463df80d4cce
Related-Bug: #1669473
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/440652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif (len(CELLS) == 1 and CELLS[0].uuid == objects.CellMapping.CELL0_UUID): # If we only have cell0 at this point, let's check again to update # the cache. original_count = len(CELLS) CELLS = objects.CellMappingList.get_all(context) if len(CELLS) > original_count: LOG.debug('Found %(count)i cells: %(cells)s', dict(count=len(CELLS), cells=CELLS))

commit_message:
Functional tests: Install SSL dependencies before compiling OVS

This patch is installing the SSL dependencies (libssl-dev/openssl-devel)
before compiling OVS when running the functional tests in the gate.
Without those packages OVS will be compiled without SSL support and will
cause the tests to fail in the gate.

Closes-Bug: #1696713
Change-Id: I42c9125ddd2ae1fa024732fed9b08f44617148f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/65/472265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Install SSL dependencies here for now as a workaround # https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1696713 if is_fedora ; then install_package openssl-devel elif is_ubuntu ; then install_package libssl-dev fi

added_lines: status=support.SUPPORTED, previous_status=support.SupportStatus( support.UNSUPPORTED, version='9.0.0', message='Trunk resource is incomplete and unsupported, currently \ only Trunk creation and deletion is working.' ) def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): # update of subports is special, but the rest can be # updated in a single go, therefore we treat subports first, # then handle the rest subports = prop_diff.pop(self.SUB_PORTS, []) # now prop_diff is the rest # TODO(nilles) Handle the case of subport deletion if subports: # subport update must be done as remove-readd # remove needs only subport IDs from prop_diff remove = [{self.PORT: sp[self.PORT]} for sp in subports] # TODO(nilles): This fails in case of subport addition with self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found: self.client().trunk_remove_subports(self.resource_id, {self.SUB_PORTS: remove}) # but readd needs all subport details if subports: self.client().trunk_add_subports(self.resource_id, {self.SUB_PORTS: subports}) # update the rest of the properties if prop_diff: self.prepare_update_properties(prop_diff) self.client().update_trunk(self.resource_id, {'trunk': prop_diff}) def check_update_complete(self, *args): attributes = self._show_resource() return self.is_built(attributes)

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I896d6d962e4c7f932bc7e0a566a3b47205be61fb
Closes-Bug:#1693670

tags changed, as tag is commonly used for
searching and filtering, and projects like
searchlight depends on the notifications.

To avoid unnecessarily building a notification
payload when notifications are disabled, this
change also adds the if_notifications_enabled

commit_message:
Send out notifications when instance tags changed

This patch adds notifications when instance
tags changed, as tag is commonly used for
searching and filtering, and projects like
searchlight depends on the notifications.

To avoid unnecessarily building a notification
payload when notifications are disabled, this
change also adds the if_notifications_enabled
decorator to send_instance_update_notification.

Change-Id: I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218
Implements: bp send-tag-notification

commit_message:
Update global requirements

Pin reno version to reno!=2.0.0,!=2.3.1,>=1.8.0
Pin sphinx version to sphinx!=1.6.1,>=1.5.1
reno=2.3.1 and sphinx=1.6.1 break releasenotes and doc tests.

Change-Id: I0c76538a0ae3c198636f9fcd20c58d69cd06bee5

subject: Use CRL for HAProxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 11:54:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/648ab9a79ac7c7aa0c58851e3447d490f1f85520', 'message': 'Use CRL for HAProxy

This sets up the CRL file to be triggered on the certmonger_user
resource. Furtherly, HAProxy uses this CRL file in the member options,
thus effectively enabling revocation for proxied nodes.

So, if a certificate has been revoked by the CA, HAProxy will not proxy
requests to it.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I4f1edc551488aa5bf6033442c4fa1fb0d3f735cd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-04 12:19:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/1bcb2835a68befb171a881f77997634d80e375eb', 'message': 'Use CRL for HAProxy

This sets up the CRL file to be triggered on the certmonger_user
resource. Furtherly, HAProxy uses this CRL file in the member options,
thus effectively enabling revocation for proxied nodes.

So, if a certificate has been revoked by the CA, HAProxy will not proxy
requests to it.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I4f1edc551488aa5bf6033442c4fa1fb0d3f735cd
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-04 12:34:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/0e05ef1b8e96f438fba1664b8a98b26ae9c76ead', 'message': 'Use CRL for HAProxy

This sets up the CRL file to be triggered on the certmonger_user
resource. Furtherly, HAProxy uses this CRL file in the member options,
thus effectively enabling revocation for proxied nodes.

So, if a certificate has been revoked by the CA, HAProxy will not proxy
requests to it.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I4f1edc551488aa5bf6033442c4fa1fb0d3f735cd
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-04 14:41:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/2ece6663d4acea62bc0621e68f779489f3b40eff', 'message': 'Use CRL for HAProxy

This sets up the CRL file to be triggered on the certmonger_user
resource. Furtherly, HAProxy uses this CRL file in the member options,
thus effectively enabling revocation for proxied nodes.

So, if a certificate has been revoked by the CA, HAProxy will not proxy
requests to it.

commit_message:
Use CRL for HAProxy

This sets up the CRL file to be triggered on the certmonger_user
resource. Furtherly, HAProxy uses this CRL file in the member options,
thus effectively enabling revocation for proxied nodes.

So, if a certificate has been revoked by the CA, HAProxy will not proxy
requests to it.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I4f1edc551488aa5bf6033442c4fa1fb0d3f735cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/15/462515/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: unless empty($haproxy_certificates_specs) { reload_haproxy = ["systemctl reload haproxy"] Class['::tripleo::certmonger::ca::crl'] ~> Haproxy::Balancermember<||> } else { reload_haproxy = [] } class { '::tripleo::certmonger::ca::crl' : reload_cmds => $reload_haproxy, }

commit_message:
Containerize Congress API service

Closes-bug: #1668929

Change-Id: I051edcf2980bb9c2521e21c410055690c012a0d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/34/465734/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: pike description: > OpenStack containerized Congress API service parameters: DockerNamespace: description: namespace default: 'tripleoupstream' type: string DockerCongressApiImage: description: image default: 'centos-binary-congress-api:latest' type: string DockerCongressConfigImage: description: image default: 'centos-binary-congress-api:latest' type: string EndpointMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json ServiceNetMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service_name -> network name. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. This mapping overrides those in ServiceNetMapDefaults. type: json DefaultPasswords: default: {} type: json RoleName: default: '' description: Role name on which the service is applied type: string RoleParameters: default: {} description: Parameters specific to the role type: json resources: ContainersCommon: type: ./containers-common.yaml CongressApiBase: type: ../../puppet/services/congress.yaml properties: EndpointMap: {get_param: EndpointMap} ServiceNetMap: {get_param: ServiceNetMap} DefaultPasswords: {get_param: DefaultPasswords} RoleName: {get_param: RoleName} RoleParameters: {get_param: RoleParameters} outputs: role_data: description: Role data for the Congress API role. value: service_name: {get_attr: [CongressApiBase, role_data, service_name]} config_settings: map_merge: - get_attr: [CongressApiBase, role_data, config_settings] step_config: &step_config get_attr: [CongressApiBase, role_data, step_config] service_config_settings: {get_attr: [CongressApiBase, role_data, service_config_settings]} # BEGIN DOCKER SETTINGS puppet_config: config_volume: congress puppet_tags: congress_config step_config: *step_config config_image: list_join: - '/' - [ {get_param: DockerNamespace}, {get_param: DockerCongressConfigImage} ] kolla_config: /var/lib/kolla/config_files/congress_api.json: command: /usr/bin/congress-server --config-file=/etc/congress/congress.conf --log-file=/var/log/congress/api.log permissions: - path: /var/log/congress owner: congress:congress recurse: true docker_config: # db sync runs before permissions set by kolla_config step_3: congress_init_logs: start_order: 0 image: &congress_image list_join: - '/' - [ {get_param: DockerNamespace}, {get_param: DockerCongressApiImage} ] privileged: false user: root volumes: - /var/log/containers/congress:/var/log/congress command: ['/bin/bash', '-c', 'chown -R congress:congress /var/log/congress'] congress_db_sync: start_order: 1 image: *congress_image net: host privileged: false detach: false volumes: list_concat: - {get_attr: [ContainersCommon, volumes]} - - /var/lib/config-data/congress/etc/:/etc/:ro - /var/log/containers/congress:/var/log/congress command: ['congress-db-manage', '--config-file', '/etc/congress/congress.conf', 'upgrade', 'head'] step_4: congress_api: start_order: 15 image: *congress_image net: host privileged: false restart: always volumes: list_concat: - {get_attr: [ContainersCommon, volumes]} - - /var/lib/kolla/config_files/congress_api.json:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/config.json:ro - /var/lib/config-data/congress/etc/congress/:/etc/congress/:ro - /var/log/containers/congress:/var/log/congress environment: - KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY=COPY_ALWAYS host_prep_tasks: - name: create persistent logs directory file: path: /var/log/containers/congress state: directory upgrade_tasks: - name: Stop and disable congress_api service tags: step2 service: name=openstack-congress-server state=stopped enabled=no

subject: App fails to deploy with latest murano dashboard code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 19:24:59.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/unit/catalog/test_views.py', 'muranodashboard/catalog/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard/commit/a78f8fae669eb971f9104152baeb0c1806193175', 'message': 'App fails to deploy with latest murano dashboard code

The latest murano dashboard code requires django version 1.9.13.
This django version has removed the REQUEST attribute from the
WSGIRequest object.  There is code in the murano dashboard (in
2 places) where it still uses this attribute.  The changes here
remove this attribute.

Change-Id: I10e61164b007de10552513eb71267297aeb9bf16
Closes-Bug: 1696753
'}]
commit_message:
App fails to deploy with latest murano dashboard code

The latest murano dashboard code requires django version 1.9.13.
This django version has removed the REQUEST attribute from the
WSGIRequest object.  There is code in the murano dashboard (in
2 places) where it still uses this attribute.  The changes here
remove this attribute.

Change-Id: I10e61164b007de10552513eb71267297aeb9bf16
Closes-Bug: 1696753
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/86/472386/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Target cell on local delete

This fixes an issue where we don't actually target the cell if we're
doing a local delete. We might have the cell from earlier in the checks,
but if not, we look it up and use it.

We can't hit this if we have a single cell, but we do if we're running
on multi-cell and do the "delete while booting" tests in tempest. Indeed,
this issue was discovered whilst working through the backlog of failures
with the dependent devstack change to enable multi-cell.

Change-Id: I718ca99fcef7e83fe1955685ca4c3366df02efe8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/464059/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cell = None if cell is None: # NOTE(danms): If we didn't get our cell from one of the # paths above, look it up now. cell, instance = self._lookup_instance(context, instance.uuid) if not instance or not cell: # NOTE(danms): If we couldn't find our instance and our # cell, we can't do anything in local delete. return LOG.debug('Doing local delete in cell %s' % cell.identity) with nova_context.target_cell(context, cell) as cctxt: self._local_delete(cctxt, instance, bdms, delete_type, cb) quotas.commit()
deleted_lines: self._local_delete(context, instance, bdms, delete_type, cb) quotas.commit()

commit_message:
Add block/always to tempest result file tasks

The tempest result files should always be generated, regardless of
a tempest test failure or not. With out the block/always statement,
the tempest result files would only generate if the tempest tests
succeeded. This commit adds the block/always around the result file
tasks so that they are generated when the tempest tests fail.

Change-Id: I6698d52a7209005449fdb69a35eeaad763c59da9
(cherry picked from commit b014f5253367bf8f09071b550ed38886e7b24480)

commit_message:
Role Specific parameter for nova-compute service

The parameters NovaVcpuPinSet, NovaReservedHostMemory and
NovaPCIPassthrough are modified to support role-specific
parameter inputs.
Change-Id: I7c11e8fc2c933f424318e457cb1e96acb8df2ec7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/81/465481/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Merging role-specific parameters (RoleParameters) with the default parameters. # RoleParameters will have the precedence over the default parameters. RoleParmaetersValue: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: type: json value: map_replace: - map_replace: - nova::compute::vcpu_pin_set: NovaVcpuPinSet nova::compute::reserved_host_memory: NovaReservedHostMemory - values: {get_param: [RoleParameters]} - values: 'NovaVcpuPinSet': {get_param: NovaVcpuPinSet} 'NovaReservedHostMemory': {get_param: NovaReservedHostMemory} - get_attr: [RoleParmaetersValue, value] map_replace: - map_replace: - JSON_PARAM: NovaPCIPassthrough - values: {get_param: [RoleParameters]} - values: 'NovaPCIPassthrough': {get_param: NovaPCIPassthrough}
deleted_lines: JSON_PARAM: {get_param: NovaPCIPassthrough} nova::compute::vcpu_pin_set: {get_param: NovaVcpuPinSet} nova::compute::reserved_host_memory: {get_param: NovaReservedHostMemory}

commit_message:
Install libssl-dev before compiling OVS

The SSL functional tests in networking-ovn is currently failing because
OVS is being compiled without SSL support, turns out that "libssl-dev"
is not installed in the host.

Change-Id: I27c901c3737e943b2dd41b63b94f22ce24c4f2bf
Closes-Bug: #1696713

commit_message:
Add support for running kuryr with ocata devstack.

The signature for run_process is different between older and newer versions of
devstack. This patch works around those issues by calling sudo directly.

However, sudo cannot be called in systemd so we use the new signature when
IS_SYSTEMD is True and sudo in all other instances.

Ocata:  run_process service "command-line" [group]
Master: run_process service "command-line" [group] [user]

Change-Id: Ia2ca599fe1dc5df945425b27dc5ac70c93f47f8e
Closes-Bug: 1693323
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/86/470586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$USE_SYSTEMD" = "True" ]]; then run_process docker \ "$dockerd_bin --debug=true \ -H unix://$KURYR_DOCKER_ENGINE_SOCKET_FILE" "root" "root" else run_process docker \ "sudo $dockerd_bin --debug=true \ -H unix://$KURYR_DOCKER_ENGINE_SOCKET_FILE" fi if [[ "$USE_SYSTEMD" = "True" ]]; then run_process kubelet "$command" root root else run_process kubelet "sudo $command" fi

commit_message:
objects: exclude revision_number from updatable fields

Revision service plugin is the entity that updates the database model
attribute, and we don't allow to modify the attribute on API layer. We
should not allow to explicitly update it on OVO layer either.

This can help with spurious unit test failures that sometimes try to
update revision number and then reuse the same number to fetch the
object. If revision service plugin decides to bump the number during the
test case execution once more, using the old number may yield no
results.

Change-Id: I4666c672223ac38508738b739207f754847c62bc
Closes-Bug: #1694753
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/02/469602/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # revision numbers are managed by service plugin and are bumped # automatically; consumers should not bump them explicitly cls.fields_no_update += ('revision_number')

commit_message:
[VMware] Add missing permission for the vCenter service account

Nova driver is settings annotations for the created VMs and thus the
vCenter service account needs to have
"Virtual machine\Configuration\Setannotation" permission.

Change-Id: Iccd725fb2f394f187fdfed8921c4fc4f48586344
Closes-Bug: #1696666

subject: Connect using physical host's ansible_host var
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 04:47:19.000000000', 'files': ['strategy/linear.py', 'connection/ssh.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/8f8d9cfa11d6e1ca9426d53f99b6aa20bd331579', 'message': "Connect using physical host's ansible_host var

Within the strategy plugin set a host var, 'physical_host_addr', which
corresponds to the 'ansible_host' var of the host's 'physical_host'.

Use this within the connection plugin rather than the hostname of the
physical host, which may not exist in DNS or the deployment host's
hosts file.

Closes-Bug: 1695944
Change-Id: I75f9d0f55ecd875caa1bf608a77c92f950b679a1
"}]
commit_message:
Connect using physical host's ansible_host var

Within the strategy plugin set a host var, 'physical_host_addr', which
corresponds to the 'ansible_host' var of the host's 'physical_host'.

Use this within the connection plugin rather than the hostname of the
physical host, which may not exist in DNS or the deployment host's
hosts file.

Closes-Bug: 1695944
Change-Id: I75f9d0f55ecd875caa1bf608a77c92f950b679a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/61/472061/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def set_host_overrides(self, host, hostvars=None): if self._container_check() or self._chroot_check(): self.host = self._play_context.remote_addr = hostvars.get('physical_host_addr')
deleted_lines: if self._container_check() or self._chroot_check(): self.host = self._play_context.remote_addr = self.physical_host

commit_message:
Add resource to fetch CRL

This will fetch the CRL file from the specified file or URL. Furtherly
it will set up a cron job to refresh the crl file once a week and notify
the needed services.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I38e163e8ebb80ea5f79cfb8df44a71fdcd284e04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/14/462514/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == class: tripleo::certmonger::ca::crl # # Class that downloads the appropriate CRL file from the CA. This can # furtherly be used by services in order for proper certificate revocation to # come into effect. The class also sets up a cron job that will refresh the CRL # once a week. Also, processing of the CRL file might be needed. e.g. most CAs # use DER format to distribute the CRLs, while services such as HAProxy expect # the CRL to be in PEM format. # # === Parameters # # [*crl_dest*] # (Optional) The file where the CRL file will be stored. # Defaults to '/etc/pki/CA/crl/overcloud-crl.pem' # # [*crl_source*] # (Optional) The URI where the CRL file will be fetched from. # Defaults to undef # # [*process*] # (Optional) Whether the CRL needs processing before being used. This means # transforming from DER to PEM format or viceversa. This is because most CRLs # by default come in DER format, so most likely it needs to be transformed. # Defaults to true # # [*crl_preprocessed*] # (Optional) The pre-processed CRL file which will be transformed. # Defaults to '/etc/pki/CA/crl/overcloud-crl.bin' # # [*crl_preprocessed_format*] # (Optional) The pre-processed CRL file's format which will be transformed. # Defaults to 'DER' # # [*minute*] # (optional) Defaults to '0'. # # [*hour*] # (optional) Defaults to '1'. # # [*monthday*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*month*] # (optional) Defaults to '*'. # # [*weekday*] # (optional) Defaults to '6'. # # [*maxdelay*] # (optional) Seconds. Defaults to 0. Should be a positive integer. # Induces a random delay before running the cronjob to avoid running all # cron jobs at the same time on all hosts this job is configured. # # [*reload_cmds*] # (Optional) list of commands to be executed after fetching the CRL list in # the cron job. This will usually be a list of reload commands issued to # services that use the CRL. # Defaults to [] # class tripleo::certmonger::ca::crl ( $crl_dest = '/etc/pki/CA/crl/overcloud-crl.pem', $crl_source = undef, $process = true, $crl_preprocessed = '/etc/pki/CA/crl/overcloud-crl.bin', $crl_preprocessed_format = 'DER' $minute = '0', $hour = '1', $monthday = '*', $month = '*', $weekday = '6', $maxdelay = 0, $reload_cmds = [], ) { if $crl_source { $ensure = 'present' } else { $ensure = 'absent' } if $maxdelay == 0 { $sleep = '' } else { $sleep = "sleep `expr \${RANDOM} \\% ${maxdelay}`; " } if $process { $fetched_crl = $crl_preprocessed } else { $fetched_crl = $crl_dest } file { $fetched_crl : ensure => $ensure, source => $crl_source, mode => '0644', } if $process { $crl_dest_format = $crl_preprocessed_format ? { 'PEM' => 'DER', 'DER' => 'PEM' } # transform CRL from DER to PEM or viceversa $process_cmd = "openssl crl -in ${$crl_preprocessed} -inform ${crl_preprocessed_format} -outform ${crl_dest_format} -out ${crl_dest}" exec { $process_cmd : path => '/usr/bin', subscribe => File[$fetched_crl] } } else { $process_cmd = [] } # Fetch CRL in cron job and notify needed services $cmd_list = concat(["${sleep}curl -L -o ${fetched_crl} ${crl_source}"], $process_cmd, $reload_cmds) $cron_cmd = join($cmd_list, ' && ') cron { 'fetch crl file': ensure => $ensure, command => $cron_cmd, environment => 'PATH=/usr/bin SHELL=/bin/sh', user => 'root', minute => $minute, hour => $hour, monthday => $monthday, month => $month, weekday => $weekday, } }

commit_message:
Fix handle_restore for server and volume resources

When resource references are used for properties restore
does not work for nova server and volume resources.

This patch fixes it and adds a functional test for it.

 Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py

There is very minor conflict in server.py as the code
has been changed in pike for translation refactoring.

Change-Id: I34efb3f4e0d3578d95134793f5c5d413667790e0
Closes-Bug: #1687009
(cherry picked from commit a8129573d221284a482e84e62a7e8b0732318bfe)

commit_message:
Reference the new pre-update/pre-upgrade groups

The new 'pre-update' and 'pre-upgrade' groups contain validations that
check everything is in order before attempting an undercloud or
overcloud minor update of major upgrade. This commit makes the new
groups visible in the documentation.

Change-Id: Ie4526a868a0266b4630bd06d21f90013e2aa4c19
Partially-Implements: blueprint pre-upgrade-validations

commit_message:
`[keystone]` should be `[keystone-base]` in doc

This can be misleading when building source-type images, as `[keystone]`
doesn't work as expected.

Change-Id: Id59fa5f05e4ddeb4ac0afc111a4fc516c503e58b

commit_message:
Noisy Neighbor Strategy
renamed cache occupancy strategy to noisy neighbor

Implements: blueprint noisy-neighbor-strategy

Co-Authored-By: Susanne Balle <sleipnir012@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Prudhvi Rao Shedimbi <prudhvi.rao.shedimbi@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ia4334aadaf4b97325514528c31305cb5d3d773df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/62/398162/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Cache Occupancy Strategy ======================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/cache-occupancy-strategy This spec adds new strategy that migrate VM consuming huge cache to avoid noisy neighbor. Problem description =================== Noisy neighbor is a big problem in multi-tenant clouds. Some VM monopolizes CPU, I/O and network bandwidth, and negatively affect other VM's performance. There is already strategy to cover some of them, like CPU utilization. But LLC is not resolved at this point. LLC(Last Level Cache), or L3 cache in X86, is critical and limit system level resource shared by all apps or VMs on the node. If one VM occupy most of L3 cache, other VMs on the node likely starve without enough L3 cache thus poor performance. Use Cases ---------- As an openstack operator, I need find the noisy neighbor for L3 cache then migrate it to another node with less L3 cache competition for good isolation and performance. Proposed change =============== This spec need add one goal and one strategy for its purpose * Adds one new goal, like cache_optimization * Extend base strategy classes to add one new strategy, like CacheOccupancy * Use Ceilometer client to get following metrics for detecting noisy neighbor: * cpu_l3_cache - occupancy on a VM basis * cache_miss - total # of misses, L2 and L3 level correlate to VMs * memory.bandwidth - local and total defined per VM * An algorithm to detect if cache occupancy goes beyond threshold with system level cache starving and then choose the right target node for migration. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Querying metrics probably cause small performance drop, but it only happens when running this strategy and could be alleviated by optimize the metrics storage backend. Other deployer impact --------------------- To enable these cache metrics, latest Intel server with CMT support is required. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <edwin-zhai> Work Items ---------- 1. function to get required metrics via Ceilometer client 2. Define proper threshold for cache accupancy and memory bandwidth 3. Write the execute function to locate the noisy neighbor: both cpu_l3_cache and memory bandwidth are high. Then select the least L3 cache competition node as target for live migration. This can be done in similar way as the one choosing noisy neighbor. Dependencies ============ * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/APIv2 * http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/telemetry-measurements.html * http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-novaclient/api.html Testing ======= Unit and funcational test are needed. Documentation Impact ==================== Adds doc of how to use this strategy. References ========== http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/architecture-and-technology/resource-director-technology.html https://01.org/zh/packet-processing/cache-monitoring-technology-memory-bandwidth-monitoring-cache-allocation-technology-code-and-data History ======= None .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Liberty - Introduced

commit_message:
Fix live migration devstack hook for multicell environment

This just fixes up the ceph live migration test hook code to use the
config that nova-compute is using if we're in a multicell environment.

Change-Id: Ibc4b21089ef86ab2430874c39d63174528c9a83e

commit_message:
[WIP]Support metadata for backup resource-2

Now only volume and snapshot has metadata property.
We should support it for backup as well.

For comfortable review, this feature will be done in
three patches:
1. Add/update the related db table and ovo model.
2. Update the related backup CRUD APIs. (This patch)
3. Add new APIs for backup metadata.

Change-Id: I1b4a291f6749e46654fa1e791953cb1980527fc7
Implements: blueprint metadata-for-backup

commit_message:
Fix an issue with namespace of scenario

While abandoning alignment to OpenStack we forgot the case when custom
scenarios inherits from OpenStackScenario class, but do not setup proper
namespace(it was ok previously). This patch setups proper namespace and
prints a warning for plugin owner.

Change-Id: Icb2a27c8a8d607e6b2627dbd211f57801b24d5bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/16/462516/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from rally.plugins.openstack import scenario as os_scenario if (issubclass(scenario_cls, os_scenario.OpenStackScenario) and namespace == "default"): LOG.warning( "Scenario '%(scen)s' is located in 'default' " "namespace. Since it inherits from OpenStackScenario, " "possibly it's namespace should be 'openstack'. " "Please contact plugin maintainer to fix that issue if" " it is true. Proper namespace is a guarantee of " "proper discovering contexts (users context is " "different for different platforms, i.e openstack, " "kubernetes). As for now, we assume that your plugin " "is in openstack namespace, but in future it will be " "changed since default namespace doesn't need users " "context and so on + we do not want to align to only " "OpenStack deployments.") namespace = "openstack"

commit_message:
Catch neutronclient.NotFound on floating deletion

In some cases, trying to delete a floating IP multiple times in a short
delay can trigger an exception beacause the floating ip deletion
operation is not atomic. If neutronclient's call to delete fails with a
NotFound error, we raise a 404 error to nova's client instead of a 500.

Change-Id: I49ea7e52073148457e794d641ed17d4ef58616f8
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1649852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/410815/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.FloatingIpNotFoundForAddress: msg = _("Floating ip not found for address %s") % address raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg)

commit_message:
use plain routes list for os-virtual-interfaces

This patch adds os-virtual-interfaces related routes by a plain list,
instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to
the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be
removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I47ccef43e41da0a85bff3da71655c33b6fea4fe4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/462173/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: placement: test for agg association not sharing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-02 20:33:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cff6ffb1ab923c9d369662ea10c28f03e466f33e', 'message': 'placement: test for agg association not sharing

Adds yet another functional test scenario that demonstrates an environment with
a set of compute nodes with no local disk connected to a shared storage
provider via an aggregate and a set of compute nodes with no local disk
associated to an aggregate with a provider having DISK_GB inventory but not
decorated with the MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE trait.

This emulates a deployment where you might have a mix of shared and non-shared
storage compute nodes grouped into different host aggregates and you want
fine-grained control over which providers are sharing some resource with
providers in the host aggregate.

Change-Id: Ie71e23b7f51756df4dab2ffb3b7fa938e1a4b475

commit_message:
placement: test for agg association not sharing

Adds yet another functional test scenario that demonstrates an
environment with a set of compute nodes with no local disk connected to
a shared storage provider via an aggregate and a set of compute nodes
with no local disk associated to an aggregate with a provider having
DISK_GB inventory but not decorated with the MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE
trait.

This emulates a deployment where you might have a mix of shared and
non-shared storage compute nodes grouped into different host aggregates
and you want fine-grained control over which providers are sharing some
resource with providers in the host aggregate.

Change-Id: Ie71e23b7f51756df4dab2ffb3b7fa938e1a4b475
blueprint: shared-resources-pike
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/01/461901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create another two compute node providers having no local disk # inventory and associated with a different aggregate. The created a # storage provider but do NOT decorate that provider with the # MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE trait and verify that neither of the new # compute node providers are returned by _get_all_with_shared() cn4_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn4 cn4 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn4', uuid=cn4_uuid, ) cn4.create() cn5_uuid = uuidsentinel.cn5 cn5 = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='cn5', uuid=cn5_uuid, ) cn5.create() # Populate the two compute node providers with inventory, sans DISK_GB for cn in (cn4, cn5): vcpu = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=24, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=24, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=16.0, ) memory_mb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=cn, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, total=1024, reserved=0, min_unit=64, max_unit=1024, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.5, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[vcpu, memory_mb]) cn.set_inventory(inv_list) # Create the storage provider but do NOT mark it sharing its inventory # with other providers ns_uuid = uuidsentinel.ns ns = objects.ResourceProvider( self.context, name='non_shared storage', uuid=ns_uuid, ) ns.create() # Give the shared storage pool some inventory of DISK_GB disk_gb = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=ns, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=2000, reserved=0, min_unit=10, max_unit=100, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=1.0, ) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[disk_gb]) ns.set_inventory(inv_list) # Ensure neither cn4 nor cn5 are in the returned providers list, # because neither has DISK_GB inventory and although they are # associated with an aggregate that has a storage provider with DISK_GB # inventory, that storage provider is not marked as sharing that # DISK_GB inventory with anybody. got_rps = rp_obj.ResourceProviderList._get_all_with_shared( self.context, resources, ) got_ids = [rp.id for rp in got_rps] self.assertEqual([cn1.id], got_ids)

commit_message:
add new test fixture flavor with extra_specs

We support flavor extra_specs, so it would probably make sense to
have some in one of the test fixture flavors.

In order to make it compatible with the functional tests we'll make
it as small as m1.tiny.
Change-Id: Ic98d7dd2f44796279e18083a8c423aed0066d177

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting,
which is replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx
releases >= 1.5[0].

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html


Change-Id: Id02deddc52d81b9cd240364a22422a31fc02c9c4

subject: Use Neutron (if available) to create floating IPs for validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-05 19:51:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a80b16155619bbd979ef97b793e19aad86df8e33', 'message': "Use Neutron (if available) to create floating IPs for validation

The 2.36 microversion in the compute API deprecates the os-floating-ips
API since it's a proxy when using Neutron, and nova-network is deprecated.

When ssh validation is enabled in a Tempest run, we should create the
floating IP using Neutron if available and only fallback to the compute
API if using nova-network.

Change-Id: Ib345abdeec17fef85f99beb0ff4f3639e95acf6f

commit_message:
Use Neutron (if available) to create floating IPs for validation

The 2.36 microversion in the compute API deprecates the os-floating-ips
API since it's a proxy when using Neutron, and nova-network is deprecated.

When ssh validation is enabled in a Tempest run, we should create the
floating IP using Neutron if available and only fallback to the compute
API if using nova-network.

Change-Id: Ib345abdeec17fef85f99beb0ff4f3639e95acf6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/16/471116/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if CONF.service_available.neutron: validation_data.update( os.floating_ips_client.create_floatingip( floating_network_id=CONF.network.public_network_id)) else: # NOTE(mriedem): The os-floating-ips compute API was deprecated # in the 2.36 microversion. Any tests for CRUD operations on # floating IPs using the compute API should be capped at 2.35. validation_data.update( os.compute_floating_ips_client.create_floating_ip( pool=CONF.network.floating_network_name))

commit_message:
Use get_rpc_transport instead of get_transport

With the added get_rpc_transport() function in oslo.messaging [1]
and the recent version bump of oslo.messaging to 5.24.2, we can
safely replace get_transport() with get_rpc_transport() which is much
cleaner.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454194/

Change-Id: I36a5b2fceae36bc5abb36c421a5cea046fd28db3

commit_message:
Modify libvirtd container command line when TLS is enabled

Libvirtd needs the --listen arg to enable the TLS socket.

Resolves-Bug: #1694958

deleted_lines: from dragonflow.db.models import migration # update migration flows for VM migration def update_migration(self, migration_obj): # This method processes the migration event sent from source node. # There are three parts for event process, source node, destination # node, other nodes which related to topic of migrating VM, according # to the chassis ID in lport, and local chassis.. if migration_obj.status != migration.MIGRATION_STATUS_SRC_UNPLUG: return original_lport = migration_obj.lport.get_object() lport = self.nb_api.get(original_lport) port_id = lport.id dest_chassis = migration_obj.chassis if not dest_chassis: return if dest_chassis.id == self.chassis_name: # destination node ofport = self.vswitch_api.get_port_ofport_by_id(port_id) lport.ofport = ofport lport.is_local = True self.db_store2.update(lport) LOG.info("dest process migration event port = %(port)s" "original_port = %(original_port)s" "chassis = %(chassis)s" "self_chassis = %(self_chassis)s", {'port': lport, 'original_port': original_lport, 'chassis': dest_chassis.id, 'self_chassis': self.chassis_name}) if original_lport: original_lport.emit_remote_deleted() lport.emit_local_created() return # Here It could be either source node or other nodes, so # get ofport from chassis. ofport = self.vswitch_api.get_vtp_ofport(lport.lswitch.network_type) lport.ofport = ofport remote_chassis = dest_chassis.get_object() if not remote_chassis: # chassis has not been online yet. return lport.peer_vtep_address = remote_chassis.ip LOG.info("src process migration event port = %(port)s" "original_port = %(original_port)s" "chassis = %(chassis)s", {'port': lport, 'original_port': original_lport, 'chassis': dest_chassis}) # source node and other related nodes if original_lport and lport.chassis.id != self.chassis_name: original_lport.emit_remote_deleted() lport.emit_remote_created()

commit_message:
hyper-v: Adds support for ISO images

ISO is added as a supported format in imagecache, meaning that
ISOs can be attached to VMs. ISOs are attached the same way
VHD / VHDX disks are attached.

Co-Authored-By: Adelina Tuvenie <atuvenie@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyper-v-boot-from-iso

Change-Id: I3704c2c391944351a5a9c58d08360db622e5c8bf

commit_message:
Adds CPUFeaturesField to ImageMetaProps

Certain images can request certain CPU features through the
image metadata properties (for example, an image can require the
'vmx' CPU feature in order to enable nested virtualization).

This commit defines the CPUFeature enumeration and the CPUFeaturesField,
and adds the 'hw_cpu_features' field to the ImageMetaProps object.

DocImpact: The glance-property-keys page of the cli-reference docs will
have to be updated to include details about the "hw_cpu_features" image
property and its possible values.

Change-Id: Id118764d77684d3387ac7c90150b8ad571d7a8f0
Partially-Implements: blueprint hyper-v-nested-virtualization

commit_message:
hyper-v: Adds support for VMs with nested virtualization

Nested virtualization is a new feature introduced in
Windows / Hyper-V Server 2016.

The nova Hyper-V Driver will enable nested virtualization for
an instance if the given instance flavor extra_specs
"hw:cpu_features" or the given instance image property
"hw_cpu_features" contains the CPU feature "vmx".

An instance with nested virtualization enabled, cannot have
dynamic memory.

DocImpact: The compute-flavors page of the admin guide will
have to be updated to include information about the "hw:cpu_features"
extra_specs.

Depends-On: I238161a8cd1d589a7d57fe9cf74b18b22679998c

Change-Id: Ie780dfc48abeabfd7a9319ce4fe66ba914a73988
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-nested-virtualization
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/398509/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nested_virt_enabled = self._requires_nested_virt(instance) dynamic_memory_ratio = CONF.hyperv.dynamic_memory_ratio if nested_virt_enabled and dynamic_memory_ratio != 1: # NOTE(claudiub): instances requiring nested virtualization cannot # have dynamic memory. Set dynamic memory ratio to 1 for the # instance. (disabled) LOG.warning(_LW("Instance %s requires nested virtualization, but " "host is configured with dynamic memory " "allocation. Creating instance without dynamic " "memory allocation."), instnace.uuid) dynamic_memory_ratio = 1 if nested_virt_enabled: self._vmutils.set_nested_virtualization(instance.name, state=True) def _requires_nested_virt(self, instance): cpu_features = instance.flavor.extra_specs.get('hw:cpu_features') if cpu_features and 'vmx' in cpu_features.lower(): if self._hostutils.supports_nested_virtualization(): return True reason = _('Host does not support nested virtualization.') raise exception.InstanceUnacceptable(instance_id=instance.uuid, reason=reason) return False

commit_message:
[Generic driver] Fix incompatibility with novaclient

Novaclient has removed lots of proxies to other clients such as
'images' [1], 'networks' [2] and 'security_groups' [3].
So, fix incompatibilities the way we can work with old and
new novaclient versions.

[1] I2d9fd0243d42538bd1417a42357c17b09368d2a5
[2] I8c520100a0016eed3959619c71dae037ebd72939
[3] I6fa14f43d48f1e035ef54bd2d0078506f0c6d6e0

Change-Id: Id7383329b2491f76579f042cbed06585c2214815
Closes-Bug: #1691445
(cherry picked from commit 5d5666b10e57a94bcde06c8a296002175d935c7b)

added_lines: def test_image_list_novaclient_has_no_proxy(self): image_list = ['fake', 'image', 'list'] class FakeGlanceClient(object): def list(self): return image_list self.novaclient.glance = FakeGlanceClient() result = self.api.image_list(self.ctx) self.assertEqual(image_list, result) def test_image_list_novaclient_has_proxy(self): image_list1 = ['fake', 'image', 'list1'] image_list2 = ['fake', 'image', 'list2'] class FakeImagesClient(object): def list(self): return image_list1 class FakeGlanceClient(object): def list(self): return image_list2 self.novaclient.images = FakeImagesClient() self.novaclient.glance = FakeGlanceClient() result = self.api.image_list(self.ctx) self.assertEqual(image_list1, result)
deleted_lines: class FixedIPs(object): def get(self, fixed_ip): return dict(address=fixed_ip) def reserve(self, fixed_ip): return None def unreserve(self, fixed_ip): return None self.fixed_ips = self.FixedIPs() def test_fixed_ip_get(self): fixed_ip = 'fake_fixed_ip' result = self.api.fixed_ip_get(self.ctx, fixed_ip) self.assertIsInstance(result, dict) self.assertEqual(fixed_ip, result['address']) def test_fixed_ip_reserve(self): fixed_ip = 'fake_fixed_ip' result = self.api.fixed_ip_reserve(self.ctx, fixed_ip) self.assertIsNone(result) def test_fixed_ip_unreserve(self): fixed_ip = 'fake_fixed_ip' result = self.api.fixed_ip_unreserve(self.ctx, fixed_ip) self.assertIsNone(result) def test_network_get(self): net_id = 'fake_net_id' net = self.api.network_get(self.ctx, net_id) self.assertIsInstance(net, dict) self.assertEqual(net_id, net['id'])

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

commit_message:
Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support
Depends-On: I84726b577dc108ff748fb331812197651b4fbbac
Change-Id: I69f4409d73d2c786e3a94a88b76d6e0386f9a999
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/320832/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from os_brick.initiator import connector from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from nova import utils from nova.virt.libvirt.volume import volume as libvirt_volume CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_opt('num_iscsi_scan_tries', 'nova.virt.libvirt.volume.iscsi', group='libvirt') LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class LibvirtFibreChannelECKDVolumeDriver( libvirt_volume.LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver): """Driver to attach Fibre Channel ECKD volumes to libvirt.""" def __init__(self, connection): super(LibvirtFibreChannelECKDVolumeDriver, self).__init__(connection, is_block_dev=False) # Call the factory here so we can support # more than x86 architectures. self.connector = connector.InitiatorConnector.factory( 'FIBRE_CHANNEL_ECKD', utils.get_root_helper(), use_multipath=CONF.libvirt.iscsi_use_multipath, device_scan_attempts=CONF.libvirt.num_iscsi_scan_tries) def get_config(self, connection_info, disk_info): """Returns xml for libvirt.""" conf = super(LibvirtFibreChannelECKDVolumeDriver, self).get_config(connection_info, disk_info) conf.source_type = "block" conf.source_path = connection_info['data']['device_path'] conf.driver_io = "native" return conf def connect_volume(self, connection_info, disk_info): """Attach the volume to instance_name.""" LOG.debug("Calling os-brick to attach ECKD Volume") device_info = self.connector.connect_volume(connection_info['data']) LOG.debug("Attached ECKD volume %s", device_info) connection_info['data']['device_path'] = device_info['path'] if 'multipath_id' in device_info: connection_info['data']['multipath_id'] = \ device_info['multipath_id'] def disconnect_volume(self, connection_info, disk_dev): """Detach the volume from instance_name.""" LOG.debug("calling os-brick to detach ECKD Volume") # TODO(walter-boring) eliminated the need for preserving # multipath_id. Use scsi_id instead of multipath -ll # This will then eliminate the need to pass anything in # the 2nd param of disconnect_volume and be consistent # with the rest of the connectors. self.connector.disconnect_volume(connection_info['data'], connection_info['data']) LOG.debug("Disconnected ECKD Volume %s", disk_dev) super(LibvirtFibreChannelECKDVolumeDriver, self).disconnect_volume(connection_info, disk_dev)

Fix ci

The ci is break[0]. I guess that it is the problem caused by package
of octavia. Temporarily not initializing the database.

subject: Fix the port for Panko API in devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 01:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/panko/commit/0bbaa200893a3ff9f4770b807b11aa890dbbd133', 'message': 'Fix the port for Panko API in devstack

The port used for Panko in devstack is conflicts with Trove[1].
The 8777 port has been occupied by ceilometer. So set the panko
api port to 8977.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L61

Change-Id: If6621a6bd1c6a5486d85ee33ec0760c8bbe1f860
Closes-Bug: #1696613
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the port for Panko API in devstack

The port used for Panko in devstack is conflicts with Trove[1].
The 8777 port has been occupied by ceilometer. So set the panko
api port to 8977.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L61

Change-Id: If6621a6bd1c6a5486d85ee33ec0760c8bbe1f860
Closes-Bug: #1696613
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/panko refs/changes/80/471980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove 'state' argument from later cmd_* calls

With I468dbf5134947629f125504513703d6f2cdace59 each node has a
reference to the global state object.  This means it gets pickled into
the node-list, which is loaded for later calls.  There is no need to
reload the state.json it and pass it for later cmd_* calls, as the
nodes can see it via the unpickled self.state

Change-Id: I9e2f8910f17599d92ee33e7df8e36d8ed4d44575
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/50/469750/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def umount(self): # these values should have persisteted from create() assert self.state['test_b']['value'] == 'baz' assert 'umount' not in self.state self.state['umount'] = [] self.state['umount'].append('test_b')
deleted_lines: def umount(self, state): assert 'umount' not in state state['umount'] = [] state['umount'].append('test_b')

commit_message:
Adds tests for compute snapshots API

Adds compute API tests for create, delete, show, and list
snapshots. Also corrects max_microversion for compute/test_volume_rbac
to 2.38 and changes test class name to follow Patrole class naming
conventions (include min_microversion in class name).

Change-Id: Ie04dfa26f598a818dfc3d6eb440dec3e29c5b604
Closes-Bug: #1692173

subject: Make use of Ubuntu Cloud Archive switchable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-10 12:24:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/1b7bcfdef041d8ce35eb8aaee21a27eb042140d7', 'message': "Make use of Ubuntu Cloud Archive switchable

The trove development environment is typically a linux VM within which
openstack is installed, and trove launches guest vm's within that
environment. To make it possible for these vm's to launch in one human
lifetime, one must set vt/x and enable nested hypervisors to use with
kvm; qemu emulation will take way too long.

The new libvirtd (v2.5.0) in Ubuntu Cloud Archive doesn't handle
nested hypervisors well and if you use it, you end up with a guest
hanging on the GRUB line.

To enable that use-case, we provide DISABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE which
the trove developer can set before running devstack.

Change-Id: Ia0265c67bb7d2a438575a03c0ddbf2d9c53266ed
Closes-Bug: #1689370
